intro: Galium irinae, commonly known as Irina's bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs with opposite leaves. The plant features slender stems that often lie close to the ground, producing small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Galium irinae is typically found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist environments.
